N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 116.3 - Educational programs and services

State Regulations

Except as otherwise authorized pursuant to section
116.4
of this Part, educational
programs and services provided by any State department or agency or political
subdivision shall meet the following requirements in addition to those set
forth in section
116.2
of this Part. (a) The length of the school day shall be
comparable to that required by section
175.5
of this Title. The school day
shall include instructional services and, for pupils with handicapping
conditions, related services, as such term is defined in section
200.1
(dd)
of this

Title, but shall not include transportation. (b) Personnel qualifications. All
professional instructional personnel shall have the required certificates as
set forth in Part 80 of this Title, except as otherwise provided in
subdivisions (d) and (e) of this section. (c) Safety education shall be provided
equivalent to that required in Part 107 of this Title. (d) Physical education and athletic programs
shall be provided equivalent to those required by sections
135.1, 135.2
and
135.4
of this Title, except that
interschool athletic programs are not required. Approval may be granted by the
commissioner for a variance from the requirement of certification of the
physical education teacher upon a finding that the instructor has equivalent
background and training. (e) Health
education shall be provided equivalent to that required in section
135.3
of this Title, except that
approval may be granted by the commissioner for a variance from the requirement
of certification of the health education teacher upon a finding that the
instructor has equivalent background and training. Notes
